item.title: Abandoned work signs left blocking pavement, 27th November
item.description:
Several sets of dumped signage on pavement along Cheltenham Rd / junc with Heathdean. Has been there weeks. Can see this was already reported end Oct. It is a danger in the dark nights.

item.title: Abandoned barriers in ditch, 27th November
item.description:
At least 2 half-height barriers in the ditch on left hand side of Kidnapper's lane just after you enter from Farm Lane. Don't appear to belong to the housing contractors as they have their own full-height fencing and the abandoned barriers are on the public/school side of the fencing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Glebe Road Prestbury roadworks and flooding repairs., 27th November
item.description:
Glebe Road Prestbury roadworks and flooding repairs have done immense damage to the road, the kerbs and the verges. The workmen have been intermittent in attendance and leave the road in a terrible state, I cannot walk around the green without slipping on the piles of mud and the mess that has been created. It is not accepatable and none of the residents is clear about what has been achieved or whether the green, the verges and the kerbs will be put in a good state once finished. Nobody clears up at the end of each day and in fact no staff have turned up today the 27th November 2025. Its not looking good.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Glebe Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of leaves on verge, 27th November
item.description:
Large pile of leaves collected up by workers for collection but forgotten. All other piles in vicinity collected. Damage will occur to verge if not attended to. Thank you for your assistance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Pittville Crescent, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Work in Glebe rd Drains, 27th November
item.description:
The workers have left site in a dangerous condition. It is very difficult to get in and out of our houses with equipment, barriers cones left all around the green. There is copious amounts of mud on the roads and paths which has not been cleared away at any point of the work undertaken. This is a big project and has taken weeks to sort out. All the curbs are in a mess as well as our beloved green . Can someone please come out and access the damage done .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Glebe Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 27th November
item.description:
Tree letter
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 27th November
item.description:
We have had a structural engineer out to our house to look at cracking in the internal and external walls. It is the view of the engineer that there is some shifting of foundations, due to the clay on which these houses are built, and the dry summer we have had. However, he also said the large tree outside our property will be contributing to the dryness as the roots will be sucking up the moisture in the ground. He recommended that the tree be attended to; trimming or crowning it would reduce its water requirements and help our situation. I believe, as the tree is in the pavement, so to speak, it falls to Highways to help us out, if at all possible?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two sets of dumped material, which looks like could be ASBESTOS, 27th November
item.description:
They are in two points, about 10 meters apart, behind the low hedge near the Waitrose roundabout, in the green area, between Grt Western Rd and the Honeybourne Line. There was also a pillow and some blanket flytipped on the ramp to the Honeybourne Line.

item.title: Abandoned motorbike, 27th November
item.description:
Pittville Mews - short narrow access road to rear of properties on Pittville Lawn and Evesham Road. Motorbike parked on double yellow lines for past 4 years at least without moving. Obviously not driveable. Hazard to large vehicles such as waste collection lorries reversing down road. Still has registration plates on bike if you want to know that can be given to you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Pittville Mews, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ringway barriers, weeds and rubbish on pavement, 27th November
item.description:
Directly outside no 16 all saints road. Been there since the summer. Weeds getting worse and barrier often messed with. Council says issue solved case closed, unfortunately it does not appear that way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree maintenance on Milton Road, 27th November
item.description:
We have had a structural engineer out to our house (57 Milton Road) to look at cracking in the internal and external walls. It is the view of the engineer that there is some shifting of foundations, due to the clay on which these houses are built, and the dry summer we have had. However, he also said the large tree outside our property will be contributing to the dryness as the roots will be sucking up the moisture in the ground. He recommended that the tree be attended to; trimming or crowning it would reduce its water requirements and help our situation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Milton Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
